comments:
We are seeing this exception intermittently during virtual component creation
inside our new project wizards:

java.version=1.5.0_03
java.vendor=BEA Systems, Inc.

Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

This will be very hard to recreate without a junit test, or some other
recreatable scenario...   Was there another exception before this one?

(In reply to comment #1)
> This will be very hard to recreate without a junit test, or some other
> recreatable scenario...   Was there another exception before this one?

No, there didn't appear to be another exception before this. I can investigate a
bit and see if I can create something a little more reproducible.

[Transfering comment and cc members from bug 104237]

The com.bea.*.features.* classes you see above are now available for your 
review in 
the features framework submission that's in CVS.

In particular, please take a review the
  *.features.base.WebFeatureInstallDelegate.execute()
method and make sure that we are creating the VirtualComponent correctly.  
Perhaps we're not calling createComponent correctly?  Maybe we need to 
be "locking" the edit model somehow?

Here's the snippet:

            final IVirtualComponent c
                = ComponentCore.createComponent( project, project.getName() );

            c.create( 0, null );
We'll investigate in M9 when feature work is integrated.
This should be fixed in latest M9 WTP drivers.  Have not seen issues at all in M9.

This bug is being moved to the "closed" state since it has been in the fixed state for a so long it is being assumed fixed, without explicit verification from the originator. If there is still a problem, in the most recent 1.5.x builds, please reopen or open another bug.
